page.title: 01Simonburns N W Hinterland
page.content:
Population-approx 100 in 45 dwelling houses spread widely across area. Simonburn only signifcant community (18 hours) 3 large country houses, 11 farms, 31 houses
Land - changes gently from bleak open moorland in west, though partly wooded hills of grazing, split by 5 steeply sloping steam valleys down to rich parkland on the banks of the river N Tyne
Land use-65% rough grazing for fat cattle/sheep. 20% small private coniferous forest 10% arable 5% housing
Occupations- primarily farming increasing occupation (say 20%) of farmhouses/cottages by executives commuting to Tyneside.
